programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton go head to head with New Orleans' locals at The Big Easy where a musical item at the auction sets their pulses racing.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. The day of Karen's big event arrives, but Ashley gives Les an ultimatum that could change American Jewelry and Loan for ever.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Pilot of the series following colourful life in a large pawn shop, as run by the Gold family. From alligators to false limbs, its staff has no idea what could come through the door next, and profits come with a huge risk.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike finds a rare retro motor in a West Virginia museum, and takes a fancy to an electronic peacock.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: One of the teams puts the hunt on hold to protect local children from an alligator terrorising their neighbourhood, while another group adopts a secret new strategy.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A new competitor threatens Jamie's business, while the crew members are forced to pull out all of the stops to prevent a truck from losing its load.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get the chance to buy the suit of KFC founder Colonel Sanders and a vintage punching-bag game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine a collection of Sammy Davis Jr's personal tapes, and a pair of 1950s Schwinn Phantom bicycles.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a boer head in hope of a trade, and a woman wants cash for a fur coat despite the summer heat. Series following life in a large pawn shop..

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A threatening customer puts the store on a high alert, while Ashley and Seth bet on whether a stripper's pole will sell.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate ancient tales and accounts of robots, contemplating that if such sophisticated machines did exist in bygone days, what might have happened to them.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The story of two researchers who launch an investigation into the supposed UFO crash in Shag Harbour, Nova Scotia on October 4, 1967. Locals claim to have seen and heard the craft hovering above the surface before falling into the waters off the shoreline. While the Navy, coast guard and police were all dispatched, the government claims there was no trace of anything suspicious.

programme.title: Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: The San Bruno pipeline explosion of September 2010, when, in a suburb of San Francisco, a 30-inch diameter steel natural gas pipeline ruptured, killing eight residents.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers discover a collection of personal letters by Kennedy brothers John, Bobby and Teddy, and vintage Mickey Mouse telephones.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers land the chance to buy a hand grenade made for a Second World War espionage initiative by the Americans, and a 1950s peep-show machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers celebrate the discovery of a rare, unopened bottle of 1921 Dom Perignon, and uncover a collection of Freddy Krueger dolls from A Nightmare on Elm Street.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers find an antique professional gambler's kit and ponder a 1950s radiation detector and 19th-century currency.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell takes a gamble on a locker completely covered with blankets, while Brandi makes a risky decision.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell finds a box of old books, Jarrod and Brandi battle for a unit filled with classic signs, and Barry takes a chance on a mystery trunk.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton head to an auction in Louisiana, but the duo are out of their league due to a lack of Southern hospitality.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton travel to Missouri to stay with Ton's sister for some rest and recuperation, but on the way they head for an auction.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash over whether they should be armed after Les's confrontation with a customer, and Ashley fails to close a deal.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash when a man brings in an angry pet alligator he wants rid of. Les has to keep his composure to avoid making a bad decision.

programme.title: Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: An instance when engineers struggled to repair a mega-tunnel beneath Seattle when their machine was buried. Plus, a luxury cruise ship that burst into flames.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: UFO sightings throughout the world during the highly active period of the 1970s. The sightings spread across locations from Kansas to New Zealand.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether the stories of a time when gods and otherworldly beings inhabited the planet are more than mere mythology.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists investigate a depiction of a stegosaurus found at Angkor Wat in Cambodia, comtemplating whether it suggest that alien species killed off the dinosaurs.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The captains are pushed to breaking point when a novice fisherman and pleasure boaters cause them to lose thousands of dollars' worth of bluefin tuna.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones uncover a Marilyn Monroe statue, an industrial slip n' slide and a bed of nails at a live auction in Mission Hills, California.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff heads to an auction on his own where he finds LARP weaponry, a sword collection and falconry gear, while Ton Jones soups up their new truck.

programme.title: Ozzy and Jack's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Ozzy and Jack Osbourne visit the Alamo, taking a Mars Rover for a spin at Nasa's Johnson Space Station along the way.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Chase fails to show up for his second day as captain, and Dwaine struggles to live up to his dad's expectations.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers travel to the latest set of auctions in Fullerton, California, where Jarrod and Brandi compete for a storage unit they need to keep their store afloat.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are far from home and get the opportunity to find out who has the skills for the job and who is just relying on luck.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton head to an auction in Louisiana, but the duo are out of their league due to a lack of Southern hospitality.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton travel to Missouri to stay with Ton's sister for some rest and recuperation, but on the way they head for an auction.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actor David Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz from October 2016, with Labour MP Chris Bryant and New Zealand comedian Rose Matafeo joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack return with previously unseen material from the ninth series of the comedy panel show. Features a stellar cast of celebrity guests, who try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Comedy game show hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster, in which leading comedians are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations and scored on how well they would deal with them. The first episode features Tom Allen, Rob Beckett, Jessica Knappett and Liza Tarbuck.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian is accused of starting a war, and the only way he can prove his innocence is through trial by combat.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright thinks he has pulled a fast one by offloading a job lot of genuine Yorkshire clothes horses onto rival shopkeeper Albert Gupta - until his competitor makes a profit on them. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Arthur of Brittany: The Boy Who Should Have Been King
programme.desc: Prince Arthur of Brittany, who was subjected to the injustice of his bad uncle, John Plantagenet, the usurper of his throne and crown of England.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: The Princes in The Tower: Royal Blood
programme.desc: Examining the case of the princes in the tower, and questioning whether or not Richard III ordered their deaths.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Revisiting the killing of brilliant but controversial young playwright Christopher Marlowe, who was stabbed to death in a Deptford lodging house in 1593.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the theory that Nazis were engaged in building spacecraft before the outbreak of the Second World War.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The people responsible for tracking down war criminals who had evaded capture, beginning with the US army task force in charge of locating German scientists.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Documentary exploring unusual rail networks from around the world, beginning with a look at trains in cities, including an inverted monorail in Wuppertal, Germany. With contributions from Susana Esteves da Fonseca.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of the Vajont Dam in the mountains of northern Italy, and the catastrophic flood in 1963 that caused the deaths of 2000 people.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: White Pass and Yukon Railroad - The Gold Rush Railway
programme.desc: The White Pass and Yukon Railroad over the US-Canada border, which began construction after the Klondike Gold Rush in the late 19th century and saw 35 workers lose their lives.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: High-definition cameras and aerial photography techniques are used to explore the archipelago, which is rich in wildlife and made famous by Charles Darwin's On the Origin of the Species. This programme focuses on the geological history of the islands through the evidence of volcanic eruptions and examines what makes it unique. Tilda Swinton narrates.

programme.title: Spy in the Wild
programme.desc: Natural history documentary in which spy cameras camouflaged as various animals go 'undercover' in the animal world, getting up close and personal to film their behaviour. Spy Pup is immersed in wild dog life to explore their maternal love, and Spy Penguin records the turbulent action of the mating season, as a male Adelie penguin falls victim to a pebble thief that ruins his chances of love for the season. Spy Tortoise and Spy Bushbaby keep watch on chimpanzees, while in perhaps the most moving scenes, Spy Monkey becomes the focus of attention for a troop of concerned langurs who believe the motionless camera-creature has died.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The wilderness lines that have pushed the frontiers of human endeavour into previously unknown territories, solving a set of complex problems along the way.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's personal secretary Martin Bormann and the efforts to track him down. With insufficient evidence to confirm the Nazi official's death, the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg tried him in absentia during 1946 and eventually sentenced him to death. Despite extensive efforts, he was never found and was eventually presumed to have died in May 1945.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where America's two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind an abandoned Second World War aviation facility in Farnborough, a Soviet airbase in the Gobi Desert, and a disused furnace in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn goes behind the scenes at London's King's Cross station and finds out about the disused funicular railway hidden in the Avon Gorge in Bristol, blasted out of the cliff.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville changes his image with the help of some trendy clothes and a medallion made from a cocoa tin lid, while Arkwright decides to increase his profits through advertising.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville places an ad in a lonely hearts magazine and finally meets the girl of his dreams. After stretching the truth about being a young executive with a flash sports car, his romance ends before it even begins. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright thinks he has pulled a fast one by offloading a job lot of genuine Yorkshire clothes horses onto rival shopkeeper Albert Gupta - until his competitor makes a profit on them. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: First episode of John Sullivan's comedy series, following the lives of Only Fools and Horses characters Boycie and Marlene. Denzil tells Boycie the infamous Driscoll Brothers are after the supergrass who had them jailed - prompting the car salesman to sell his business and move to rural Shropshire. John Challis and Sue Holderness star, with a guest appearance by Paul Barber.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Tyler and Marlene are not impressed by their new surroundings and want a swift return to Peckham, but Boycie warms to the idea of becoming a 'gentleman farmer', which seemingly involves doing little work and mingling with the country set. His manager Elgin persuades him to retain all his staff.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie puts Marlene under pressure to fit in with the locals, so she decides to take up cookery - an idea that does not go down well with her family. She orders her husband to pick blackberries for a pie, causing him to inadvertently trespass on the land of his anti-English neighbour. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A terminally ill man's body is donated to medical research, but Sam uncovers evidence to suggest his death may not have been entirely natural. Amanda Burton stars as the sceptical forensic pathologist, with Mick Ford and William Armstrong.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: The Boys Are Back in Town
programme.desc: Neil Manson and estranged wife Pippa consider getting back together, while Gabriel takes the opposite course in his private life and decides to stop seeing secret girlfriend Zoe Dowman. Sheelagh brings daughter Siobhan into the station to experience a day in the life of a police officer, while Jack Meadows and the CID team investigate the source of fake passports being printed somewhere in Sun Hill.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Hoax calls are still causing problems for Blue Watch, but then a genuine emergency arises in the boiler room of a swimming pool. Meanwhile, Nick heads to Cyprus.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kathy falls out with Phil over a mysterious woman that has entered his life. Gita loses her patience with Sanjay as she is stuck at home with the baby and Pat worries about Janine.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Colonel Fortune is worried about the prospect of merging with another regiment, and Second Lieutenant Kate Butler faces hostility from the Marines during an exercise.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The company is sent to New Zealand for a training exercise, where Paddy and Dave take a new recruit under their wing. Guest starring Lena Headey.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: The Boys Are Back in Town
programme.desc: Neil Manson and estranged wife Pippa consider getting back together, while Gabriel takes the opposite course in his private life and decides to stop seeing secret girlfriend Zoe Dowman. Sheelagh brings daughter Siobhan into the station to experience a day in the life of a police officer, while Jack Meadows and the CID team investigate the source of fake passports being printed somewhere in Sun Hill.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Michael faces his appeal hearing, and uses the opportunity to try to patch things up with Connie, while Sam shares a secret with Chrissie. Lola discovers Leanne's father Steve has been admitted, and becomes convinced he is a drug user.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie's recuperation is cut short by a single mum who disappears, leaving him holding the baby, and Chloe moonlights to help make ends meet - but the long hours are taking their toll. Josh regrets opening his mouth to a stranger and two burglars make it a busy night in Holby A&E. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson and Ian Bleasdale.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Amanda Prosser steals all the credit for Gina's impressive initiative on antisocial behaviour, and teenage rapist Ross Trescot begs June to drop the charges against him, trying to excuse his actions by claiming to be a victim of sexual abuse. Roger finds himself attracted to a mugging victim's housemate, while Jo Masters and Suzie Sim present Neil with incriminating photographs of his father-in-law.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark, Michelle, Clem and Shelly set off for their weekend away, and in the square Gita's suspicions are aroused.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Shelly struggles to come to terms with Mark revealing his HIV status to her. Clem confronts Mark after he assumes Mark spent the night with Shelly.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch forget their personal problems as a band's video shoot ends in a massive blaze in a disused factory, presenting the team with one of their biggest challenges yet.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Paul strives to create a good impression on Lucy's parents, and Ewan makes an unwelcome discovery about his father. Donald looks forward to cruising the open road in the Morgan, while Isobel and Jess get their wires crossed when they pass a wedding shop.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Drama about community nurses living and working in a small Yorkshire town.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey and Sharon witness a robbery committed by someone they know, leaving them agonising over whether to turn a blind eye or inform on a mate. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie faces his worst nightmare when Marlene's sister decides to pay a visit from Peckham. As if the man-eating glamourpuss was not enough to cope with, he finds all his staff tied up in the barn - and realises his past has come back to haunt him. Guest starring Paula Wilcox.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Deep in the Heart of Yorkshire
programme.desc: When Sid and Wally are seen disappearing into the woods, their wives Ivy and Nora wonder what they are up to, so press Compo, Clegg and Foggy to find out. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, written by Roy Clarke.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy criticises local folklore and upsets Compo and Clegg by condemning a Yorkshire god called Earnshaw. However, subsequent events suggest he has been foolish to voice his opinions. Long-running comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Jo takes on a distressing case in which a waste incinerator company is accused of deliberately hiding a design fault, with harmful consequences for the community. Meanwhile, the home secretary is accused of accepting a bribe - but the evidence goes missing, enabling him to call for Deed's impeachment. Starring Martin Shaw, with Jenny Seagrove and Aneirin Hughes.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the murder of an East German immigrant, but all they have to go on are his mysterious final words, which translate as 'blue flower'. As they piece together his remarkable story, Sandra tries to gain the trust of his estranged daughter. Crime drama, starring Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Ross is certain there's more to a woman's death than meets the eye, and suspects there's a link with another unsolved murder. However, Sam remains unconvinced and, as she struggles to cope with the lingering memory of a previous case, begins to question her future. Amanda Burton, Mick Ford and William Armstrong star.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: 1000 Heartbeats
programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win 25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five workmates answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Salman, Glynis, Rory and Claire pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The acerbic GP investigates after local farmer Dennis Thorpe shoots at Robert for taking some of his eggs. Meanwhile, Emily returns to the surgery to see Martin after her acne medication caused a bad reaction, a secret bidder buys the Crab and Lobster pub, and Louisa ponders if she should see a fertility specialist.

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: As summer begins, Delyth starts planning for the wedding season and the staff at Portmeirion celebrate the work of Susan Williams-Ellis - the pioneer behind its pottery. The programme also meets Rob Piercy, who has spent 25 years capturing the village on canvas.

programme.title: How to Keep Your Dog Happy at Home
programme.desc: Tips on how to keep dogs mentally stimulated during lockdown. James Martin reveals how he looks after two pets with very different types of intelligence, and learns new tricks for keeping them both happy. Among the family pets featured are a border collie that has been trained to herd turkeys and a dog that takes great pleasure in getting stuck under a side table several times a day.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts the big-prize quiz, in which another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives. All they have to do is hold their nerve through 15 questions, with four lifelines on hand to help them - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Rising Damp Forever
programme.desc: Part two of two. Director Joe McGrath - who was tasked with transferring the comedy action to the big screen for Rising Damp: The Movie - is reunited with Christopher Strauli, who recalls the challenges of stepping into Richard Beckinsale's shoes following his tragic death.

credits.director: transferring the comedy action to the big screen for Rising Damp: The Movie - is reunited
who recalls the challenges of stepping into Richard Beckinsale's shoes following his tragic death

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on a journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the second episode, Ryan, Adam and Scott attempt to find their inner zen at a huge meditation hall, and Scott gets a fiery fix-up Indian style by a hairdresser who prefers flames to scissors. Later, a special family meeting leads to showman Dougie hitting the stage in Mumbai.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts the big-prize quiz, in which another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives. All they have to do is hold their nerve through 15 questions, with four lifelines on hand to help them - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Edd China completes the restoration project, Mike Brewer has the 1984 Corvette C4 valued ready for selling.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton and Hus head to freezing Finland following a hot tip. Up near the Arctic Circle there's a kind of Winter Wonderland of Second World War vehicles and equipment..

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Building custom motorcycles with the gang at Orange County Choppers.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: Five of the world's most impressive seafaring vessels are pitted against one another in a variety of key categories.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe assists the US Coastguard to recover and clean large, barnacle-covered buoys off the coast of San Francisco.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The materials and manufacturing processes that go into making ochre and hurdy gurdies.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The development and manufacturing of exhaust headers and moulded limestone artwork. Plus, spiral stairs and pita bread.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating next-generation race-cars that run on electricity. Plus, the creation of mead, favourite drink of the Vikings.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Drew Pritchard counts down some of his most memorable buys, from the incredibly rare and valuable to the exquisite and the quirky.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Ice and injuries cause the captains to consider desperate measures as the fleet battles for survival against an Arctic hurricane.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Winter storms hit the coast, and the entire fleet must either brave the perilous conditions or stay in port and miss out on a valuable catch.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: A Blackpool landmark is set for an explosive ending. Plus, the artist who made a giant First World War soldier out of scrap metal tries to tame a dragon.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a cheap BMW M5 in a terrible condition, and Edd China has his work cut out trying to rejuvenate the dilapidated vehicle so it can turn a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini meets a woman who asks him to sell a Chevrolet that belonged to her husband and that has not been driven for years.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini checks out a classic Bimbo racer. He likes the vehicle, but it needs a lot of work and its present owner is driving a hard bargain.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The processes used to turn used aluminium cans into planes and rockets. Plus, the way in which a traditional Black Forest cuckoo clock is carved.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How manufacturer Lea and Perrins concocts its famous Worcestershire sauce. Plus, the shredding of cars and the making of sarees.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Rookie crew-members and veterans alike battle to recover their catch rates, but human error and the ferocious elements look set to thwart their efforts.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Ramblin' Rose takes a serious risk as winter storms hit the crab grounds, and the Time Bandit gambles at the dock.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton sells an Australian museum a Second World War tank destroyer worth half a million pounds, which still needs a barrel.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard decides that he needs something different to stand out from the competition. He and Tee head to Italy hoping to find some antiques that his rivals won't be able to match.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: A giant brick tower is toppled next to a railway line. Meanwhile, one of Britain's veteran scrap kings ploughs his profits into racing cars.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer spends more than 2,000 on a 1984 Corvette C4, leaving it up to Edd China to restore it to its former glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Edd China completes the restoration project, Mike Brewer has the 1984 Corvette C4 valued ready for selling.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Brothers Peter and Mick Cooke face off in an epic scrapheap challenge to build a monster opal hunting machine. The rookies also resort to dangerous night time hunting.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Salvage supremo Drew Pritchard is spoiled for choice at a dealership in Henley, Oxfordshire. He meets a good match in Marlborough, Wiltshire, and tries to score a win against the house at a bingo hall.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Preston, a job centre is demolished and in Yeovil a 20ft yacht is ripped to pieces. Plus, in the Somerset village of Woolavington, a sculptor is on the hunt for scrap material.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a clock made from the propeller of a First World War plane, a pair of stained glass windows, and an ancient shoe-stretching machine.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of Formula One racing cars, America's best-selling multi-tool and Finnish Aalto glassware.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The rounding up of escaped pythons in Florida, the making of Panama hats, and how drivers are kept safe in the world's longest tunnel.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer purchases a 1993 Lexus LS400 for little more than 1,000, hoping mechanic Edd China can work his magic and make them a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China finishes renovation work on the Lexus LS400 - respraying the bumper, adding new wheels, fitting clear bumper lenses and putting in carpets.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride is determined to outshine her sister, and a customer has a special visitor during her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride is having a Batman-themed wedding and wants a dress inspired by her favourite villain, while another customer has high expectations for her gown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown heads to the Halls Gap Zoo in Victoria, where Stephanie the lemur is suffering with an infection in her tooth that could become a major problem if not fixed.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A look at the work of Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown and his most embarrassing cases, including a golden retriever that has developed a nasty condition.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Charles Jantzen seizes some emaciated horses that were forced to eat dirt to survive. Two of the mares have foals and are struggling to produce milk to feed them.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An emaciated horse gives birth prematurely, and the foal is so weak Dr Thurston takes it home to bottle feed.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police in New Mexico are called in to investigate when a woman disappears from a skating rink after meeting a friend.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of the 24-year-old Jennifer Kesse, who has not been seen since her abandoned car was found near her home in Orlando, Florida, in January 2006.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 32-year-old Brandy Hanna, who vanished in May 2005 after leaving her North Charleston home for a weekend away. After failing to return to the restaurant where she was employed the following Monday, North Charleston police officers had to contemplate whether she had walked away from her rocky love life or was the victim of a sinister crime.

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: The case of 44-year-old masseuse Larissa Macriello, who vanished from her Miami apartment. Police soon discovered a dangerous edge to her carefree lifestyle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Meghan is getting married in two weeks but she doesn't recognise her dress when she goes for her fitting, can it be fixed or will she buy another new gown?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Joan gives the sales consultants advice on how to manage a bride who cannot make a decision without the help of her mum, or when the mother of the bride takes over.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jennifer is on the search for a new gown after being pressured into purchasing a dress by her mother and stepmother. Elsewhere, Lisa uses her fiance as a style guide.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Jessica has fallen head-over-heels for a dress outside of her budget, but will she be willing to compromise?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Susan's family travels from New York to see her dress, while Suzanne brings along her soon-to-be mother-in-law, who she is meeting for the third time.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Jennifer clashes with her mother over the dress budget, while Kate has a crisis involving a curved band of fabric.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three collectors are given 800 euros to spend at a Nice market in the hope of upcycling their goods and making a profit when they sell in York. Lesley Anne uses a cheap alternative to gold leaf, Emily invests a lot of money in a gold clock, and Glenn gets a surprising offer - but is he brave enough to accept it?.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan values a handbag believed to once belong to singer Cheryl, and finds a pair of designer Tom Ford shoes that could be worth a small fortune.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Janine's extreme obesity has her nearly immobile, meaning she must overcome both her physical and emotional pain if she's ever going to live a normal life again.

programme.title: 1000lb Sisters
programme.desc: Amy undergoes gastric bypass surgery, but endangers herself by not sticking to the post-op diet. Meanwhile, Tammy seeks support from her love interest.

programme.title: My Feet Are Killing Me
programme.desc: Dr Vincent faces an eight-hour surgery to repair the worst case of dancer's feet she's seen. A woman's club feet give Dr Schaeffer a shock when he removes her shoes.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: A case in which members of a family of four were murdered in their home. Detectives immediately launched a desperate manhunt for the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic scientists continually re-evaluate unsolved crimes with new evidence and advanced methods of detection.
